intro: Siphocampylus smilax, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing various alkaloids. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and a woody stem, typical of the Solanaceae family. Siphocampylus smilax thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes.
